intro: Choretrum candollei, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. It produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing alkaloids. The botanical features of Choretrum candollei make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
